docs.summary: Event that is fired when a user presses a submit button on a `WixForms` element and the Wix Form is successfully submitted to the server.
description: You do not need to import `$w` or `wix-crm` to work with Wix Forms events.

docs.summary: An object representing a Wix Form field.
description: A maximum of 10 form fields can be added to the Wix Form. To add more form fields to a Wix Form, [upgrade your site](https://support.wix.com/en/article/upgrading-your-site-to-premium-3066683).

examples.title: An event when a Wix Form is submitted
body: $w('#text1').text = `Thank you, ${firstName} ${lastName}, for your generous donation of ${donation}.`;

members.name: id
members.doc: The WixForms element's unique identifier. Used when selecting elements using the `$w()` selector.

members.name: fieldValue
members.doc: Value of the field. If the field is a checkbox, its value is the checked property. If the field is a Captcha, its value is the token property. If the field is a file upload, its value is an array of the uploaded files' type.
